title: The Mill on the Floss - religious and moral ideas

content.question: From the first sentence, one can infer which of the following about the Dodsons’ and Tullivers’ religious and moral ideas?

choices.label: The narrator is unable to describe them with complete accuracy.
They have no real logical foundation.
They cannot be appreciated by anyone who does not share them.
They are not typical of those of British Protestants in general.

content.answer: They are not typical of those of British Protestants in general.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe what specific textual details reveal about a character, that character's perspective, and that character's motives.
